ygData.subject: Re: The wizard class.
ygData.msgSnippet: Well put! it is a long road...all my blade slinging friends are off in level 20 land and I am level 15 getting excited about getting my new spells and getting
ygData.messageBody:
Well put! it is a long road...all my blade slinging friends are off in level
20 land and I am level 15 getting excited about getting my new spells and
getting reseach. ...

;-)

Auraelle
15th plane of knowledge
E'ci

----- Original Message -----
From: Scott J. Chertkow <sjchertkow@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 1:15 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] The wizard class.


> From: "Scott J. Chertkow" <sjchertkow@...>
>
> Hail all. I answer the question of wizards being a weak class as I play
my
> game...in character.
>
> There is a lot of sniveling going on in the apprentice ranks of our mighty
> class. No pets, no buffs, too much meditating. Ours is not a class for
> those looking for the easy road. Find a sword or a mace and go punch a
> critter if that's your cause. Ours is a class of discipline. The road is
> hard, but so are the rewards. The magics we wield allow us to do one
thing
> that few classes can. Solo the entire realm. I'm currently of the tenth
> level, and while I have adventured with a few for fun, 97 per cent of all
of
> my time has been alone.
>
> Occasionally I even bail out the weak swordslingers, shaking at their
> fifteen point hits, while I send ice or fire raining down upon my enemies
> (and sometimes theirs) for double or even triple their damage. So there
are
> few things I fear in this world of Norrath. There are few things you
should
> as well. Use your head. Attack with caution and strategy. And use your
> spells in combinations that will win you the day. Yes we spend much time
in
> meditation, but we are the scholars, the students, and the finders of lost
> power.
>
> Adopt the right attitude and use your head in stead of your staff and
you'll
> agree.
>
> Djorin
> Level 10
> E'ci
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> ONElist: where real people with real interests get connected.
> http://www.onelist.com
